replies.body: There's also a bug with {{champion:161}} !!! Just like Sejuani, his E (Tectonic Disruption) doesn't knock up units within it's radius all the time. I tested it in custom mode and I was right. It seems to knockup units only 1/3 of the time. Please thumbs up for Riot to see this, it's very upsetting..

A similar thing seems to happen with Cho'Gath's Rupture a lot too.  The target will clearly be inside the AoE ground indicator, but they will take no damage and not be knocked up.  I do not know if the two are related, but I'd really like Riot to give some feedback on this.
Agreed, I've played a lot of {{champion:31}} recently and it is kind of inconstant with the hit box on that and the feral scream is a bit clunky too.

I had to log on for this...

I completely agree that Cho'Gath's kit honestly feels a bit clunky and clumsy at the moment. Not considering his sustain nerfs, high early mana costs, and snowbally nature of his ultimate - a Cho'Gath without 6 stacks is less strong and useful as another with all 6 feast stacks - I think all Cho'Gath players would appreciate if Riot could fine tune his inconsistencies with his heavily skill shot reliant abilities and honestly unsatisfactory movement.

As a suggestion, maybe increase the cast range on his q and/or w as he gains more feast stacks? This would synergize with the bonus attack range he gets on vorpal spikes. If I'm being too crazy, which is legitimately possible, I'd love if Riot could please just take a look at refining how he moves and the animations of his skills.

Thanks.

"Fixed a bug where Arctic Assault would stop on collision with, but fail to knock up, really large enemy champions (Cho'Gath with 6 Feast stacks, Zac with a lot of bonus HP, large champions that were Wild Growth'd by Lulu, **champions who weren't watching their diet, etc**)" Very funny Rito. reported

I don't think Nidalee is anything like Soraka.  If you dodge her spear you can jump in an punish her.  People complain about her spear because they are unable to predict and dodge, but honestly she feels pretty balanced and fun to play as and against to me.  Soraka is annoying and frustrating though.  I was hoping to see a little bit of braum nerfage.  I think he's a well rounded champ but he brings a lot more to the table than all the other supports.
Her spear isn't the problem. That combined with her very potent heal and manaless cougar form (pounce forever) means unless your entire team dogpiles her from different angles, she's getting away.

I agree with Russ completely.  Her only real positives are her ability to punish very low skill players and her ability to get away.  Otherwise there's no reason to care if she gets away.  She can't defend anything, she cant be an aggressor.  All she can do is land a big poke and run.  That's kind of really what makes her the champ she is.

What is low skill about not being able to dodge a, rather moderately fast skillshot? They are actually really only changing her because of how much play she saw in competitive, in the LCS she was almost always an insta-ban and Riot started realizing why. The width of the missile is ridiculous, and yes dodging is all fun and stuff until it hits. No spell in the game should almost one shot a full health ADC without proper setup or comboing. 

Not trying to come off as whiney just, competitive players even rocked other pro players to the core with Nid. I don't see why they wouldn't be changing her up a bit.
Nidalee can out damage Veigars ult by Mid Game. It's really disturbing.

Rest in Piece, mid lane Soraka.
